title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 6 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Chronicles chapter 6 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 6 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Chronicles Chapter 6.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 6:1, where did the LORD say He would dwell?
questions.correctAnswer: In the thick darkness
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Chronicles 6:1 states that the LORD said He would dwell in the thick darkness.

questions.question: Who built the house of habitation for the LORD according to 2 Chronicles 6:2?
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon
questions.explanation: In 2 Chronicles 6:2, Solomon says that he built a house of habitation for the LORD.

questions.question: What did Solomon do to the congregation of Israel before he blessed them in 2 Chronicles 6:3?
options: Turned his face and blessed them
questions.correctAnswer: Turned his face and blessed them
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Chronicles 6:3 says Solomon turned his face and blessed the whole congregation of Israel.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 6:6, which city did the LORD choose to put His name in?
questions.correctAnswer: Jerusalem
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:6 states that the LORD chose Jerusalem for His name to dwell there.

questions.question: Who did the LORD choose to be ruler over His people Israel as mentioned in 2 Chronicles 6:6?
questions.correctAnswer: David
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Chronicles 6:6 mentions that the LORD chose David to be over His people Israel.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 6:9, who was told to build the house for the LORD's name?
questions.correctAnswer: David's son
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:9 states that David’s son, not David himself, would build the house for the LORD’s name.

questions.question: What did Solomon place in the house he built, according to 2 Chronicles 6:11?
questions.correctAnswer: The ark of the covenant
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Chronicles 6:11 says Solomon put the ark, containing the covenant, into the house.

questions.question: What was the size of the brass scaffold Solomon made in 2 Chronicles 6:13?
options: Five cubits long, five cubits broad, and three cubits high
Ten cubits long, ten cubits broad, and five cubits high
Three cubits long, three cubits broad, and two cubits high
Seven cubits long, seven cubits broad, and four cubits high
questions.correctAnswer: Five cubits long, five cubits broad, and three cubits high
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:13 describes the scaffold as five cubits long, five cubits broad, and three cubits high.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 6:14, Solomon said there is no God like the LORD in heaven or earth.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: In 2 Chronicles 6:14, Solomon declares there is no God like the LORD in heaven or earth.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 6:18, what did Solomon question about God dwelling with men on earth?
options: Will God in very deed dwell with men on the earth?
Will men be able to see God?
questions.correctAnswer: Will God in very deed dwell with men on the earth?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:18 questions if God will truly dwell with men on the earth, noting heaven cannot contain Him.

questions.question: What does Solomon ask God to do regarding the prayers made toward the house in 2 Chronicles 6:21?
questions.correctAnswer: Hear from heaven and forgive
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Chronicles 6:21 asks God to hear from heaven and forgive the prayers made toward the house.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Chronicles 6:31 states that God alone knows the hearts of the children of men.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:30-31 affirm that God alone knows the hearts of the children of men.

questions.question: Who does 2 Chronicles 6:32 say may come from a far country to pray in the house?
questions.correctAnswer: The stranger
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Chronicles 6:32 mentions strangers from afar who come to pray in the house.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 6:36, there is no man who sinneth not.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:36 explicitly states that there is no man who sinneth not.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 2 Chronicles 6:40: 'Now, my God, let, I beseech thee, thine eyes be open, and let thine ears be ________ unto the prayer that is made in this place.'
questions.correctAnswer: attent
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:40 asks God to have His eyes open and ears attent to the prayer made in the place.

medium.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 6 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Chronicles Chapter 6 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with doubt about God's presence. Based on 2 Chronicles 6, what biblical truth would you share about God's dwelling?
options: God chooses to dwell with His people even if He is beyond all heavens
God only dwells in the heavens and never on earth
God dwells only where the ark is physically placed
God's presence depends on human merit
questions.correctAnswer: God chooses to dwell with His people even if He is beyond all heavens
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:18-20 shows that though heaven cannot contain God, He chooses to dwell in the house Solomon built and hears prayers there, assuring His presence among His people.

questions.question: How does Solomon demonstrate humility and reliance on God during the temple dedication in 2 Chronicles 6?
options: By kneeling and spreading his hands toward heaven in prayer
questions.correctAnswer: By kneeling and spreading his hands toward heaven in prayer
questions.explanation: Verse 13 describes Solomon kneeling and spreading his hands toward heaven before all Israel, showing humility and dependence on God's mercy and covenant.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 6, what is the significance of praying toward the temple?
options: It symbolizes seeking God's presence where He has chosen to put His name
It is merely a tradition without meaning
It is required only for priests
It is a way to show superiority over other nations
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes seeking God's presence where He has chosen to put His name
questions.explanation: Verses 20-21 and 34-35 emphasize praying toward the temple as the place where God has chosen to put His name, signifying reverence and trust in God’s presence and justice.

questions.question: What does Solomon ask God to do when His people sin and pray toward the temple, according to 2 Chronicles 6?
options: Hear from heaven, forgive their sin, and restore them
Allow their enemies to destroy the temple
questions.correctAnswer: Hear from heaven, forgive their sin, and restore them
questions.explanation: Verses 24-25, 27, and 39 describe that when Israel confesses and prays toward the temple, God will hear, forgive, and restore them to their land, highlighting His mercy and readiness to forgive.

questions.question: A believer asks why Solomon did not build the temple himself. What biblical principle about obedience and timing does 2 Chronicles 6 teach?
options: God chooses the right time and person to fulfill His promises
Solomon wanted to build it but was too busy
David was afraid to build the temple
The temple was built by the people, not kings
questions.correctAnswer: God chooses the right time and person to fulfill His promises
questions.explanation: Verses 8-10 explain that though David desired to build the temple, God chose Solomon, his son, to fulfill His promise, teaching obedience to God's timing and plan.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 6 teach about God's justice when people swear oaths before the altar in the temple?
options: God will judge the wicked and justify the righteous according to their ways
God accepts bribes to change judgments
questions.correctAnswer: God will judge the wicked and justify the righteous according to their ways
questions.explanation: Verses 22-23 explain that when oaths are sworn before the altar, God hears and judges fairly, rewarding righteousness and punishing wickedness, promoting integrity and justice.

questions.question: What does Solomon request for the priests and saints in his prayer at the temple dedication, reflecting Christian virtues of service and joy?
options: That priests be clothed with salvation and saints rejoice in goodness
That priests receive wealth and saints gain power
That priests remain silent and saints be humble
That priests perform sacrifices only and saints observe quietly
questions.correctAnswer: That priests be clothed with salvation and saints rejoice in goodness
questions.explanation: Verse 41 highlights Solomon's prayer for the spiritual well-being and joy of God's servants, promoting holiness, service, and gratitude.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 6, God will not hear the prayers of strangers who come to pray toward the temple.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 32-33 affirm that even strangers who come from afar to pray toward the temple will have their prayers heard, demonstrating God's inclusive mercy and the call to evangelism.

questions.question: True or False: Solomon prayed that God would remember the mercies He showed to David, His anointed servant.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 42 records Solomon's prayer asking God not to turn away from His anointed and to remember David's mercies, illustrating humility and faithfulness to God's promises.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 6 teach us about perseverance through trials when the people are taken captive?
options: If captives repent and pray toward their land, God will hear and forgive
Only priests can pray for captives
questions.correctAnswer: If captives repent and pray toward their land, God will hear and forgive
questions.explanation: Verses 36-39 explain that even in captivity, if the people repent sincerely and pray toward their land and temple, God will hear and forgive, encouraging perseverance and hope.

questions.question: A believer asks how to maintain integrity and honesty according to 2 Chronicles 6. What guidance does Solomon's prayer offer?
options: God judges each person according to their deeds and knows their hearts
Only outward appearance matters to God
Dishonest actions can be hidden from God
questions.correctAnswer: God judges each person according to their deeds and knows their hearts
questions.explanation: Verses 29-30 teach that God hears prayers and judges individuals justly, knowing their hearts, which encourages believers to live with honesty and integrity.

questions.question: What does 2 Chronicles 6 teach about the importance of family and obedience in God's covenant promises?
options: God promises David's descendants the throne if they obey His law
The covenant applies only to Solomon
The throne is given regardless of obedience
questions.correctAnswer: God promises David's descendants the throne if they obey His law
questions.explanation: Verses 16-17 highlight God's promise to David that his descendants will sit on the throne if they walk according to God's law, showing the importance of obedience and family faithfulness.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Solomon built a scaffold of _____ cubits long, _____ cubits broad, and _____ cubits high to stand upon during his prayer.
questions.correctAnswer: five, five, three
questions.explanation: Verse 13 describes Solomon's brass scaffold as five cubits long, five cubits broad, and three cubits high, where he stood to pray before the congregation.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 6, how should believers respond when experiencing drought or pestilence?
options: Pray and confess their sins toward the temple so God may forgive and send rain
Ignore the situation and continue as usual
questions.correctAnswer: Pray and confess their sins toward the temple so God may forgive and send rain
questions.explanation: Verses 26-27 instruct that in times of no rain or pestilence, if the people confess and pray toward the temple, God will forgive and bless the land with rain, highlighting repentance and faith.

questions.question: What biblical virtue is highlighted by Solomon's prayer asking God to 'turn not away the face of thine anointed' and to remember David's mercies?
questions.correctAnswer: Faithfulness and gratitude
questions.explanation: Verse 42 emphasizes Solomon's faithfulness to God's promises and gratitude for David's legacy, encouraging believers to trust God's mercy and remain thankful.

hard.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 6 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Chronicles Chapter 6.

questions.question: In 2 Chronicles 6, Solomon mentions that the LORD said He would dwell in what kind of darkness?
questions.correctAnswer: Thick darkness
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Chronicles 6:1 states, 'The LORD hath said that he would dwell in the thick darkness,' highlighting the mysterious and transcendent nature of God's presence.

questions.question: Who was chosen by God to build the house for His name, according to Solomon's prayer?
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:9 clarifies that although David desired to build the house, God declared that Solomon, his son, would build it, fulfilling the divine promise.

questions.question: What significant item did Solomon place in the house he built for the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: The Ark of the Covenant
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Chronicles 6:11 states that Solomon put the ark, where the covenant of the LORD was, into the house, symbolizing God's covenant presence with Israel.

questions.question: What was the size of the brass scaffold Solomon made in the court before the altar?
options: Five cubits long, five cubits broad, three cubits high
Ten cubits long, ten cubits broad, five cubits high
Three cubits long, three cubits broad, five cubits high
Seven cubits long, seven cubits broad, four cubits high
questions.correctAnswer: Five cubits long, five cubits broad, three cubits high
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:13 specifies the dimensions of the brass scaffold as five cubits by five cubits by three cubits, demonstrating Solomon's attention to detail in the temple courtyard.

questions.question: How does Solomon describe the LORD God of Israel in his prayer regarding His uniqueness and covenant faithfulness?
options: There is no God like thee in heaven or earth; who keepest covenant and showest mercy
The LORD is a consuming fire and a jealous God
Mighty in battle and ruler over all nations
A God who dwells in the temple alone
questions.correctAnswer: There is no God like thee in heaven or earth; who keepest covenant and showest mercy
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:14 highlights God's unparalleled nature and His covenant faithfulness and mercy to those who walk before Him with a whole heart.

questions.question: According to Solomon’s prayer, under what condition will a man be allowed to continue sitting on the throne of Israel?
options: If his children walk in God’s law as he did
questions.correctAnswer: If his children walk in God’s law as he did
questions.explanation: In 2 Chronicles 6:16, Solomon prays that the promise to David will hold as long as his descendants walk in God's law, underscoring the conditional nature of the Davidic covenant.

questions.question: In Solomon's prayer, he expresses doubt about what theological reality regarding God's presence. What is this doubt?
options: Will God indeed dwell with men on earth?
Will God forgive the sins of the people?
Will God protect Israel from enemies?
Will God grant rain to the land?
questions.correctAnswer: Will God indeed dwell with men on earth?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:18 reflects Solomon’s humility and awe, questioning if God can truly dwell among humans given the vastness of heaven and the heavens of heavens.

questions.question: What specific action does Solomon request God to do when a man sinning against his neighbor is made to swear an oath before the altar in the house?
options: Hear from heaven and judge according to righteousness
Forget the oath and forgive the man
Allow the man to repent in secret
Punish the man without hearing his oath
questions.correctAnswer: Hear from heaven and judge according to righteousness
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:22-23 asks God to hear the oath and judge fairly by punishing the wicked and justifying the righteous, demonstrating divine justice exercised through the temple.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: If the people of Israel are defeated by their enemies because they have sinned, but then return and _____ their name and pray in this house, God promises to forgive and restore them.
questions.correctAnswer: confess
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:24-25 states that if Israel confesses God's name and prays in the temple, God will forgive their sin and bring them back to the land.

questions.question: According to Solomon's prayer, what natural phenomenon will God send if His people repent and obey after a time of drought?
questions.correctAnswer: Rain
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:26-27 describes that if the heavens are shut and there is no rain due to sin, God will hear prayers and send rain upon the land once people repent.

questions.question: When diseases or pests afflict the land, and the people pray in the temple, Solomon asks God to hear their prayers and do what?
options: Forgive and render according to each man's ways
Send an angel to heal the land
Remove the temple from the city
questions.correctAnswer: Forgive and render according to each man's ways
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:28-30 explains that God will hear the supplications, forgive sins, and reward each person justly, knowing their hearts.

questions.question: True or False: Solomon prays that God will only hear the prayers of the people of Israel and not those of strangers who come from distant lands.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 2 Chronicles 6:32-33 teaches that God will also hear the prayers of strangers who come for His name’s sake, showing the temple’s role as a place of universal worship.

questions.question: How does Solomon describe the role of the temple in relation to Israel's enemies when the people go out to war and pray toward the city?
options: God will hear their prayers and maintain their cause
The temple will be destroyed to weaken the enemy
God will remain silent to test Israel
The priests will lead the battle personally
questions.correctAnswer: God will hear their prayers and maintain their cause
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:34-35 states that when Israel goes to war as God directs and prays toward the temple and city, God will hear and defend them.

questions.question: What condition does Solomon specify for God to forgive the people taken captive and praying from a foreign land?
options: They return with all their heart and soul, confessing their sins
They offer sacrifices in the land of captivity
They build a temple in the foreign land
They send gifts to the temple in Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: They return with all their heart and soul, confessing their sins
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:37-39 emphasizes heartfelt repentance and prayer toward Jerusalem as the condition for forgiveness while in captivity.

questions.question: What does Solomon request God to do for His priests and saints as He arises into His resting place?
options: Clothe priests with salvation and let saints rejoice in goodness
Make them rulers over the nations
Take them away from the city
questions.correctAnswer: Clothe priests with salvation and let saints rejoice in goodness
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:41 describes Solomon asking God to clothe the priests with salvation and cause the saints to rejoice, symbolizing divine favor and blessing.

theological.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 6 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Chronicles Chapter 6 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 6, what was God's original statement about where He would dwell?
options: In the hearts of His people
questions.correctAnswer: In the thick darkness
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:1 states that the LORD said He would dwell in the thick darkness. This indicates God's mysterious and transcendent presence. This aligns with Exodus 20:21 where God appeared in thick darkness on Mount Sinai, and with Psalm 97:2 emphasizing God's holiness and mystery.

questions.question: What reason does Solomon give for building the house (temple) for the LORD?
options: To provide a dwelling place for God forever
questions.correctAnswer: To provide a dwelling place for God forever
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:2 shows Solomon's purpose for building the temple was to provide a permanent dwelling place for God. This demonstrates God's desire to be present with His people (cf. Exodus 25:8, John 1:14, and Hebrews 9:11).

questions.question: Who did God choose to build the house for His name according to Solomon's prayer?
questions.correctAnswer: Solomon
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:9-10 clarifies that although David desired to build the temple, God chose Solomon, his son, to build it. This points to God's sovereign plan and the fulfillment of His promises (cf. 1 Kings 8:20, Psalm 132:11, and Acts 7:46).

questions.question: What is placed in the temple that Solomon built?
questions.correctAnswer: The ark of the covenant
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:11 states that Solomon placed the ark of the covenant in the temple, symbolizing God's covenant presence with Israel. This reflects God's faithfulness as in Exodus 25:22 and Hebrews 9:4.

questions.question: In Solomon’s prayer, how does he describe God’s uniqueness?
options: There is no God like Thee in heaven or earth
God is one among many gods
God dwells only in the temple
questions.correctAnswer: There is no God like Thee in heaven or earth
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:14 declares God's incomparable uniqueness, affirming His exclusive sovereignty. This matches Deuteronomy 4:35 and Isaiah 45:5 where God is proclaimed as the only true God.

questions.question: What condition does Solomon mention for David's descendants to remain on the throne of Israel?
options: That they walk in God's law as David did
questions.correctAnswer: That they walk in God's law as David did
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:16 states that David's descendants must follow God's law as he did to maintain the throne. This conditional covenant reflects blessings tied to obedience (cf. Deuteronomy 28:1-2, Psalm 89:30-37, and Luke 1:32-33).

questions.question: How does Solomon address the seeming paradox of God dwelling on earth in the temple?
options: He acknowledges heaven cannot contain God, much less the temple
He insists God can be confined to the temple
He claims God only appears to dwell on earth
He says God is less powerful in the temple
questions.correctAnswer: He acknowledges heaven cannot contain God, much less the temple
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:18 reveals Solomon's recognition of God's transcendent nature, affirming that even heaven cannot contain Him, emphasizing God's omnipresence (cf. 1 Kings 8:27, Psalm 139:7-10, and Jeremiah 23:23-24).

questions.question: What does Solomon ask God to do when His people sin and pray toward the temple?
options: Hear from heaven, forgive their sin, and restore them
Send a prophet to rebuke them
questions.correctAnswer: Hear from heaven, forgive their sin, and restore them
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:24-25 shows Solomon praying that God would forgive Israel’s sin when they repent and pray toward the temple, promising restoration. This is consistent with 2 Chronicles 7:14, Psalm 32:5, and 1 John 1:9.

questions.question: According to Solomon’s prayer, what should happen if there is a drought because of Israel’s sin?
options: If they pray and turn from sin, God will hear and send rain
questions.correctAnswer: If they pray and turn from sin, God will hear and send rain
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:26-27 teaches that God will respond to Israel’s repentance by forgiving and restoring blessings like rain. This reflects covenantal mercy as in Deuteronomy 11:13-17 and James 5:16-18.

questions.question: How does Solomon describe God's knowledge in relation to judging individuals who pray in the temple?
options: God knows the hearts of all people
God only judges by outward actions
God is unaware of hidden sins
questions.correctAnswer: God knows the hearts of all people
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:30 affirms God's omniscience, that He alone knows human hearts and judges accordingly. This aligns with 1 Samuel 16:7, Jeremiah 17:10, and Hebrews 4:13.

questions.question: What does Solomon pray concerning strangers who come from far countries to pray in the temple?
options: God will hear their prayers so all nations may know His name
questions.correctAnswer: God will hear their prayers so all nations may know His name
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:32-33 shows Solomon's inclusive prayer that God hears strangers’ prayers, demonstrating God's universal sovereignty and mission (cf. Isaiah 56:7, Psalm 67:2, and Acts 10:34-35).

questions.question: What does Solomon ask God to do when Israel goes to war and prays toward Jerusalem and the temple?
options: Hear their prayers and maintain their cause
Give them victory regardless of obedience
questions.correctAnswer: Hear their prayers and maintain their cause
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:34-35 requests God's intervention in battles when Israel prays toward the temple, emphasizing dependence on God for victory (cf. Psalm 20:1-4, Joshua 10:14, and 2 Corinthians 10:3-5).

questions.question: If Israel is taken captive because of sin, what condition does Solomon say will lead God to forgive and restore them?
options: They repent with all their heart and pray toward their land and temple
They build a new temple in captivity
They remain silent and accept captivity
questions.correctAnswer: They repent with all their heart and pray toward their land and temple
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:36-38 emphasizes heartfelt repentance and prayer toward Jerusalem as conditions for God's forgiveness during exile, consistent with Jeremiah 29:10-14 and Daniel 9:4-19.

questions.question: What does Solomon ask God to do concerning His priests and saints in the temple?
options: Clothe priests with salvation and let saints rejoice
Punish the priests for their sins
Ignore the prayers of the saints
questions.correctAnswer: Clothe priests with salvation and let saints rejoice
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:41 prays for God's protection and blessing on His priests and people, reflecting the priestly role and God's saving work (cf. Psalm 132:16, Hebrews 7:25, and Revelation 7:15-17).

questions.question: How does Solomon conclude his prayer regarding God's anointed and His mercies?
options: He asks God not to turn away from His anointed and to remember David's mercies
He asks God to punish the anointed for their sins
He asks God to forget David's covenant
He asks God to select a new king
questions.correctAnswer: He asks God not to turn away from His anointed and to remember David's mercies
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 6:42 ends with Solomon pleading for God's favor on His anointed and recalling His covenant mercies to David, affirming divine faithfulness (cf. Psalm 89:38-39, Isaiah 55:3, and Luke 1:32-33).
